result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Bessie A. Ortega, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

108PM  Recalled 1:27pm   Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. No appearance but appearance waived with Atty Chad Shamali.   Clerk JT  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:15 am. Bond continued posted w/ same conditions (see bond entry). mi

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Bessie A. Ortega, appeared.  Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco appeared for the Prosecution.     Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Deft is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agree to represent this applicant.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Target  9777 - 76th Street and Joshua R

02:14 PM  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Warrant vacated.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on April 12, 2022 at 10:00 am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  sg
